isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: KYSOR 1090 (8000 SERIES) - OPERATION

svcproc.title: BASIC ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM
svcproc.para: The basic system (no air conditioning or shutters) has an Alarmstat (200°F for Cummins and 205°F for Caterpillar and Detroit Diesel Series 60 engines), a normally closed fan clutch solenoid, and a fan clutch spring-loaded in the run position ( Figure 2).

step1.para: With the key in the OFF position, the fan will be engaged by the fan clutch spring.

Turning the key ON supplies ignition voltage from the key switch to the fan Alarmstat (which is normally closed) and the voltage is then applied to the fan clutch solenoid which will open and supply air pressure to disengage the fan.
The solenoid will continue to supply air to keep the fan clutch disengaged until the engine coolant reaches the pre-set temperature of 200° or 205°F.
At that temperature, the Alarmstat opens and cuts off the voltage to the fan clutch solenoid, which closes. Without the air supply, the fan clutch spring engages the fan.
With the fan running, the engine coolant will decrease in temperature until at 194° or 199°F the Alarmstat will close, again sending voltage to turn off the fan.
